byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter and Elian Peltier contributed reporting.

abstract: France, hosting global climate conference, takes extreme measures to contain demonstrations, including putting environmental zealots under house arrest; effort, which draws on emergency powers granted after Paris terrorist attacks, do not deter action at Place de la Republique where climate activists placed 11,000 pairs of shoes and formed almost two-mile human chain.
lead_paragraph: Despite efforts to limit any disruption to a two-week global climate conference in Paris, 174 people were taken into custody when demonstrators fought with the police.

headline.main: France Uses Sweeping Powers to Curb Climate Protests, but Clashes Erupt
headline.print_headline: France Uses Sweeping Powers to Curb Climate Protests, but Clashes Erupt

snippet: Despite efforts to limit any disruption to a two-week global climate conference in Paris, 174 people were taken into custody when demonstrators fought with the police.

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject
